meanings.definition: A thin sheath of fibrous tissue enclosing a muscle or other organ.
meanings.sent1: The fascia around the muscle helps protect it.
meanings.sent2: The doctor explained how the fascia surrounds the organ.
meanings.sent3: The fascia decided to throw a party for the muscle inside.
meanings.sent4: The fascia acted like a shield, guarding the organ within.
meanings.sent5: I imagined the fascia as a gentle hug around the muscle.

meanings.definition: A flat band of tissue below the skin that covers and connects muscles and other internal organs.
meanings.sent1: She felt the fascia beneath her skin while stretching.
meanings.sent2: The fascia connects the muscles to the skin.
meanings.sent3: The fascia went on a road trip with the muscles.
meanings.sent4: The fascia was like a bridge linking the skin to the muscles.
meanings.sent5: I pictured the fascia as a smooth ribbon holding everything together.

meanings.definition: A sheet or band of fibrous connective tissue enveloping, separating, or binding together muscles, organs, and other soft structures of the body.
meanings.sent1: The fascia wraps around the muscles like a blanket.
meanings.sent2: Doctors study how the fascia interacts with organs.
meanings.sent3: The fascia threw a surprise party for the organs.
meanings.sent4: The fascia was the glue holding the body's structures together.
meanings.sent5: I visualized the fascia as a web connecting all the body parts.
